alert.note: Alert for Cavalier; Pembina; Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:49AM CDT until July 19 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL...KITTSON...NORTHWESTERN ROSEAU... SOUTHEASTERN CAVALIER...NORTHERN WALSH AND PEMBINA COUNTIES... At 548 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Noyes to near Bowesmont to near Grafton, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Noyes, Mattson, Bowesmont, Cashel, Northcote, Hallock, Herrick, Kennedy, Lancaster and Lake Bronson. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 170 and 217. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
